full_summary:
### Total Construction Procurement for Garrison St-Jean and its Satellite Sites

#### Notice of Open Construction Source List (OCSL) Tender

**Reference Number:** MX-22636074780
**Solicitation Number:** QU22SLSN
**Publication Date:** December 12, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** March 31, 2026, 4:00 PM

**Procurement Overview**

The Department of National Defence, through Defence Construction Canada (DCC), invites contractors and suppliers to apply for inclusion on the Open Construction Source List (OCSL). The OCSL will comprise a roster of qualified contractors and suppliers for various construction services, including commercial, residential, industrial, institutional, and civil work, for Garrison St-Jean and its satellite sites in Quebec.

**Eligibility and Application Process**

All interested contractors and suppliers may submit an application to be included on the OCSL. To be considered, applicants must submit their request through the MERX posting and indicate their preferred official language (English or French). The selected language will be used for all future tenders, contracts, and communication.

**Selection Criteria**

The selection criteria for inclusion on the OCSL include, but are not limited to, pre-qualification requirements, Contractor Business Registry (CBR), and relevant trade certifications. Contractors and suppliers will be evaluated based on their technical capacity, past performance, and compliance with applicable regulations.

**Contract Requirements**

The OCSL is scheduled to be used for various construction services with an estimated value of $10 million and below. Contractors and suppliers will be invited to bid on tenders listed on the MERX, which will close electronically. A minimum of 10 business days will be required to process an application for inclusion on the OCSL.

**Exclusion Criteria**

DCC reserves the right to exclude contractors and suppliers from the OCSL if their application does not meet the stated requirements. Contractors and suppliers may also be removed from the OCSL if they fail to meet measurable performance standards or are found to be ineligible.

**Security Requirements**

Construction services under this OCSL may contain organization and personnel security requirements. Contractors and suppliers must actively hold all required security clearance(s) at the time of tender closing.

**Authorization**

In requesting to be included on the OCSL, contractors and suppliers consent to Defence Production Act R.S.C., 1985, c. D-13, s. 30, for DCC to publicly disclose their legal name, address
